metadata.Title: CVE-2014-0459 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
Unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE 7u51 and 8, and Java SEEmbedded 7u51, allows remote attackers to affect availability via unknownvectors related to 2D.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-0459` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

icedtea-7-jre-jamvm - 7u55-2.4.7-1ubuntu1
openjdk-7-demo - 7u55-2.4.7-1ubuntu1
openjdk-7-jdk - 7u55-2.4.7-1ubuntu1
openjdk-7-jre - 7u55-2.4.7-1ubuntu1
openjdk-7-jre-headless - 7u55-2.4.7-1ubuntu1
openjdk-7-jre-lib - 7u55-2.4.7-1ubuntu1
openjdk-7-jre-zero - 7u55-2.4.7-1ubuntu1
openjdk-7-source - 7u55-2.4.7-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

icedtea-6-jre-cacao - 6b31-1.13.3-1ubuntu1
icedtea-6-jre-jamvm - 6b31-1.13.3-1ubuntu1
openjdk-6-demo - 6b31-1.13.3-1ubuntu1
openjdk-6-jdk - 6b31-1.13.3-1ubuntu1
openjdk-6-jre - 6b31-1.13.3-1ubuntu1
openjdk-6-jre-headless - 6b31-1.13.3-1ubuntu1
openjdk-6-jre-lib - 6b31-1.13.3-1ubuntu1
openjdk-6-jre-zero - 6b31-1.13.3-1ubuntu1
openjdk-6-source - 6b31-1.13.3-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openjdk-7 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7u55-2.4.7-1ubuntu1').
openjdk-6 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6b31-1.13.3-1ubuntu1').
lcms2 package in trusty/esm is affected and needs fixing.
